intro: Chrysocoma aphylla, commonly known as the leafless chrysocoma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its lack of leaves, with only small, scale-like structures covering its stems. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
